intro: Helictotrichon roggeveldense, commonly known as the Roggeveld grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Roggeveld region, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its fine, grass-like foliage and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is often found growing in open areas with well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
